Given Harper & Rye is my new neighbor, I'm glad they put in a little more of an upscale spot to replace Red Devil :) 

It's an ideal spot for pre or post dinner cocktails, or anytime cocktails. Prices are fair and there is a decent selection of options, including wine and beer.  Also love that they have pool tables and TVs.  Could add in a bit more seating but other than that, we had a fun and tasty first experience!
author: Brianna M.

description: A nice spot for quality beer. The stout is a nice option. A bit noisy for talking but it has a nice couch and upstairs for people watching. I hear the hazelnut beer is really good. The crowd is mixed with groups and individuals who sit back and enjoy a beer alone.
author: Bardia B.

description:
This bar is the new hot spot in the neighborhood. Great drinks and ambiance. The only problem is that it can get too crowded, so I prefer going on a weeknight. Busy pool table in the back, and cool upstairs seating. 

Sam out.
author: Sean Z.

description:
Did a great job with the renovation, especially liked the new flooring.  Mixologists are well trained and talented.  Management didn't allow the place to get too packed.  Kudos to them.

One knock is the drinks were coming out slow.  10-12 min wait times, should be 3-4 min max but they're new.  Need to add another bartender to solely do waitress service orders and let the other 3 bartenders handle the crowd.
author: Joe I.

description: I went there on a Monday and I had the worst service ever. It was my birthday and both of the bartenders were really rude. Not recommend at all.
author: Larissa F.

description: Love this place!! Cannot get enough of the Mike and Cathi! Tom and Diane is delish as well. Love the huge ice cubes and the staff is so friendly and fast!!
author: Kat C.

description:
on World Cup Final Germany vs Argentina around 4pm
Me:  Do you make a bloody mary here?
Very Short Blond Guy Behind the Bar:  (sighs, looks at me disdainfully, as though I've asked him to make a drink that is beneath him) We don't make a bloody mary.  
Me:  Do you have mixed drinks that are not sweet?  I don't like sweet drinks.
Very Short Blond Guy Behind the Bar:  Most people don't.

I get mixology. I used to be a bartender at one of the best restaurants that ever was in San Diego.  But sometimes mixologists are just dicks that are full of themselves.  Maybe being woefully short is just too much and this guy can't handle it.  As a bartender, barman, mixologist, or whatever you want to call yourself working behind a bar, a HUGE part of your job is to create ambiance.  Very Short Blond Guy Behind the Bar at Harper and Rye, do you know what sort of ambiance you created for me in that short exchange?  Think about it- I have, and I'll never come back.  I bought a drink from you and it was tasty- something with carrot juice and mezcal(how cliche-mixologist of you), and I even tipped you $2.  I'll concede that the drink was worth it, but that was a waste of my $2, and I'm still kicking myself for not leaving after our exchange.  

The drinks here are good, from what I experienced in the one drink I had.  But of the two sides of the fence, I fall on the these-bartenders-are-full-of-themselves-dicks side.  So if you like good drinks served by assholes, then this is your spot.
author: Chris P.

description:
pretty disappointed with my experience at harper & rye. from the looks of it, the place is gorgeous and the perfect place to kickback and enjoy a few drinks.

a group of us headed here on halloween for a kickback round of cocktails. - the bar wasn't even crowded, yet the bartender was super unapproachable and grumpy. he brought us out one extra drink than what we ordered and when we told him we only wanted 5, he got upset and said that he heard us say 6. he refused to believe we only needed 5, even though there were only 5 of us there and still charged us for the 6 drinks. even though he charged us, he continued to give us dirty looks and didn't wait on us again. 

also, they don't have a full bar.
author: Mandy A.

description: This place should invest in bar tenders and management who won't brush off real ids as fakes. I've been a California resident for 29 years and have NEVER had an issue with my id, but apparently my California license doesn't "feel real".  RIP Red Devil - you are dearly missed.
author: Bri J.

description: My friend and I waited 30ins to get in and another 20 mins when we gave up on this place. I was thoroughly disappointed with this bar. I was ignored countless times. Other patrons who were there after me were served before me. It is a Marina scene bar. The crowd is mid to early 40s. Not a fan.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Love the looks of this bar, vintage and brand new at the same time. The sort of deck above the rest of the bar is nice if you want to chat away from the crowd. Some cocktails are great, some are really weird, but that's just my taste. Highly recommend in any case.
author: Leo L.

description: Great for grabbing drinks with friends on Polk. Recommend arriving before peak time to beat the crowds so you can enjoy your company. Solid drinks- bartender can help design you the ideal cocktail!
author: Jessie H.

description: Not impressed.  Crowded and loud.  Bar Tenders couldn't be bothered to mix anything not on the limited and uninspired menu.   Don't believe the hype.   Not worth it.
author: Max K.

description: First time there and I experienced an extremely discourteous staff, and unbelievably slow service. The place was busy, but it does not explain the bar tenders being obnoxious and there inability to get drinks out. If you go there plan only getting a drink every hour or so...
author: Cameron B.

description: I miss Red Devil Lounge. The bartenders suck now...way to churn out 1 drink every 5 minutes.
author: Alex S.

description:
I've been waiting to try Harper & Rye since they opened up a few months ago. I live in the 'hood, and it was fun to see them give the old RDL a total facelift.

I had high hopes and expectations for the bar, especially since there is a line out the door most weekend nights.  Sadly, the bartenders fell short.  They couldn't seem to manage the lines well, resulting in long waits.  Additionally, the mixologists short you on the alcohol; they claim to use only the "standard" 1oz pour, when we all know the standard is 1.5. They also never seemed to get the ice/liquid/booze ratio correct, resulting in 3 (back to back to back) watery and warm "jack and gingers" a friend ordered.

Overall, I'd be hard pressed to go back, unless they improved their bartender and wait staff.
author: Gigi B.

description: Bartender's a prick. If you're not American, don't come without your passport. Would say the ambiance was nice because the decor is lovely, but the bartender sh*t on the vibes.
author: Amy J.

description: Came here on a Saturday night, took a LONG time to get a drink, at least 20 min. There were 2 (maybe 3) bartenders working nonstop, but clearly that wasn't enough for the demand. One looked like Bruno Mars which was a plus, but doesn't make up for the long wait and a pretty bad whiskey sour; but the Hefeweizen was good! There's nothing too special about this place, it has the cool hipster look, but doesn't have the drinks, service, or chill atmosphere to fit it.
author: Maleenee B.

description: Love this spot. Much needed addition to the neighborhood with a thoughtful design and cocktail menu. The owners do a good job of not letting the bar get too crowded, which makes for a much better experience. It's also cool because you never know who you're gonna meet there - one time I ran into a renowned local author and poet Mark Gudaitis, and another time I saw Willie Brown. Really great spot I highly recommend.
author: Andy P.

description: Awesome Bar! It def packs in people and can be a bit crowded but well worth it! Great atmosphere! Great drinks! no complaints!
author: Kyle W.

description:
Guys of SF, come here if you're looking for an amazing guy:girl ratio. Lots of good looking ladies here. :) There was actually a line out the door by 9:30pm on Saturday. Good vibe. 

Would like to try the place again for HH to see how the crowd differs.

Good riddance Red Devil Lounge! This place was a much needed addition to Polk Street. One of my new neighborhood favorites!
author: Jeanne C.

description: Love Harper and Rye since its close to my house and relatively new. The crowd tends to be more fun and SLIGHTLY more diverse than other nearby bars. Slightly. The cocktails are very well executed and some of the best I've had around. There's an upstairs balcony area which is sort of creepy because people stand up there and lurk on people below. Other big annoying thing is there tends to be a long line unless you get there really early or really late
author: Victoria W.

description: Bar staff is unacceptable. Negative attitudes like they wish they were someplace else, and that made me want to be also! Sadly this nice space will loose lots of cool customers like they did me...
author: Dante D.

description: Came here the other night for a birthday party! Drinks were good, I think I had their take on a Pimm's. The only complaint that I had was that there was no ventilation! It was really, really hot where we were and our server never brought us water! :-(. I'd go back, but maybe when it isn't so crazy hot.
author: Christina C.

description: This bar demolished my faith in humanity. Exaggerating, sure-- justified? Absolutely. I arrived and all went well; got some drinks, met some nice people, the usual. Drama started when a server walked by and tripped, spilling the majority of drinks all over me. He said "Oh... Sorry." I went to the bouncer, and he was very sweet and apologetic. I decided to let the incident go... Until I heard a loud, distinctive crash. A wine glass had broken, and the most dangerous part, the stem, slid towards us. I saw it before my friend stepped on it. I went to see the manager, Jake. The nice bartender was appalled at the glass stem I held in my hand, but warned me not to be "emotional" with the manager. This seemed odd to me, but made sense a minute later. There was another man waiting, too. He was angry that he'd stepped on glass and it had pierced the sole of his shoe. I did not know him at all, but I watched, as Jake met with him first. I was so utterly shocked at what unfolded. The man was clearly angry, and had no solution in mind. He wanted justice, or at least acknowledgment that he had been wronged. He never got this, because the manager only argued with him for five to ten minutes about why the man was stupid for thinking anyone would care about his complaint. Who would believe him? Who would advocate for him? Who would care? I watched as the manager cut him apart, bit by bit. I'd seen this kind of arguing before--- the law school kind. I reasoned he was a 2L at best. The patron was stupid for settling-- he got his bar tab comp'd, but for me, this went far beyond that. This manager disregarded safety, common sense, and basic human dignity. I was completely disregarded after my entire shirt and jacket were soaked with God knows what. A glass broke and went completely ignored. Then, when it came to accountability, the manager could only scoff and laugh the ENTIRE way through. Well, hats off to you, Jake. I am sure you'll achieve that high esteemed status you seek, and one day you will become that stereotypical, sleazy defense lawyer you already portray yourself as. But hey, you're "on our side" right?
author: Valentina C.

description: I love this bar!!! They have alots of great drinks!!!! Lots of beers and Tequila!! Get early because then is too crowded to sit down and get a table.
author: Natalia M.

description:
A rustic feeling spot that is different than most of the other divey or cozy feeling places along Polk.  Drinks are mid-range on price, but taste great.  A unique spot for Polk, but relatively par for the course for the larger SF area.

I feel like this is a great happy hour spot.  After that it seems to get packed which is fine but the music and space sometimes are a mismatch if you want to dance and get a little looser.  Early evening this spot provides an atmosphere not the usual on Polk and is a lot of fun for sipping strong drinks with friends while enjoying a conversation and deciding where the evening will go.  The upstairs tables provide for a little more intimate setting while the downstairs open floor plan allows for a lot of mingling.  If you're lucky enough to snag the lounge area downstairs then you are set.  When it is not packed the drink service is at a great pace and usually you can get yourself to the bar.  As the night goes on getting a drink can be a daunting task, but then again that's becoming par for the course at a lot of spots around the city.  Bottom line is the drinks are well made, delicious, strong, and are served in a comfortable feeling spot that is great as the neighborhood go to for early evening drinks with friends.
author: Greg M.

description: It's a new bar!!! If you want somewhere less crowded with super attentive bartenders, go to the Buc or Shanghei's. These low ratings are acting like this should be the 4 seasons cocktail lounge and not a new bar in a neighborhood that doesn't get a lot of new additions. This place is great and I go out to see people, not make sweet love to a perfect cocktail from a bartender that will write me when I leave.
author: Sean T.

description: Delicious drinks. Tried a few of their specials one with mezcal. Woo! Not a typical drink I drink but savory. We must've gotten there earlier because when we left the line was down the street. Even got a couple of seats at the bar with my little bro. Bartenders were all guys and they were hotties. I can see how this place could be annoying if you weren't in a good mood and just wanted to chill. If we weren't sitting at the bar I imagine it would take a long time and mighty hard it get a drink because it gets packed. Filled with a bunch of pretty people who are a little uppity. Seems like one of those places to be seen and to pick up someone. I'm married and have kids so I was just happy to be out with a super strong tasty drink in my hand.
author: Tracy D.

description: I liked this place - only been here once though on a date. Drinks and service at bar were good. We were there early...once it got to be about 7 the crowd got really young & really yuppy and we left!
author: Jenny K.

description: best hot and dirty martini i have ever had in my life. that is all.
author: Raina D.

description: This is surely one of the most spacious and bright bar on polk street. Got here last evening with a few friends for a drink and loved the interiors and the space. We got ourselves the Kentucky Punch Pitcher and it was delicious. I'm surely going to check this place out in the night. But if you want to grab a drink in the evening its a great place since it has floor to ceiling windows which makes it great for some people watching.
author: Priyanka P.

description: The remodel is pretty fantastic. Space now looks light and clean and open. I'm bummed there won't be live music but pumped that there's a pool table. The cocktail menu is a bit fancy for me but I'm a bartender who drinks fernet straight and the pour is good so no complaints there. Staff is all super nice and friendly. For the Yelpers writing negative reviews I call shenanigans. I was in there for happy hour mid week and had no problem getting served or getting a drink not on their menu. As for people complaining that it's super crowded, are you kidding me? You went to a new bar, that got a lot of press, on a Saturday night,  color me surprised that it was busy. First world problems. Good for you guys hope it goes well. See ya for a drink soon.
author: paulina k.

description: Door guy was an absolute idiot. Held up the line for half an hour so he could hit on a girl. Never going back
author: Sam R.

description: I visited from SD. My friends took me to this bar after we went to Playland. Seems like a cool spot to hang out with friends. It was crowded, but not too crowded that I was still able to meet some cool people! I believe this place is going to be popular on Polk Street very soon. The choice of music is better than Playland tbh...
author: Gemma L.

description: The devil made em do it! the ghosts of buzzes past have anointed this place as a fun new Russina Hill/Pulk Gulch lower Pac Heights (anymore useless attempts at branding Polk Street hoods??)hang.
author: Matt H.

description: Good vibe until the uneducated door man yelled in pure form, "Bitch get outta my faceeeeee." Let's be real, there's professionals, and then there is door people. Go here for the drinks but do not expect to have a high class entrance. The door man has had the same job for three years plus, and clearly his aspirations and customer service are both limited.
author: Jaclyn K.

description: One of my favorite spots! Creative cocktails, great ambiance and the best bartenders around! Neighborhood/eclectic vibe is really fun.
author: Lucy R.

description: Awesome addition to the hood!!!  Fresh ingredients for all my favorite drinks.
author: Luke W.

description:
Great new spot. Got there early with friends and there was no line but the place filled up quick. The bartenders were cool as they always acknowledged that they will be right with you.  Plus, tasty cocktail menu.They didn't over pack the place which was great.

The space was designed well as you can find tables to hang with your group. We scored a table by the window and it was perfect.

The crowd was fun and easy going and the place overall had great energy.

This place is definitely a welcome addition to the neighborhood.
author: David C.

description: Had an amazing vodka and grapefruit!!!! Fresh juiced and so delicious. Fun environment and fun people. Love this place and will be back!!
author: Chelsea G.

description: Awesome new bar!!  Great drinks and great decor!!  Plenty of tables if you tire of standing around the bar.  There's even a great pool table area where we hung out while some of my friends played.  I had so much fun grabbing drinks with my co-workers one night that I brought my girlfriends back the next.  The crowd is awesome and I bet it has a lot to do w/ the bartenders and cocktail servers being so chill and friendly themselves.  I LOVED hanging out here and will for sure be back again soon!!!
author: Jena W.

description: Worst.  Sazerac.  Ever.  This place looks like it should be awesome, but apparently the bartenders don't know how to use the ingredients they have back there.
author: Amit M.

description: There's a bald bartender that works at harper and rye, you will see him as soon as you enter. He is the biggest douche bag alive.  He is rude to the customers and has bad mannerism and makes the worst drinks ever. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Alexendar J.

description: Such a great addition to polk street. The cocktails are amazing and The server Carmen is always so fun and helpful. Definitely a place to check out!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Just another new, trendy, noisy, crowded bar with a rotating specialty cocktail menu. There's nothing wrong with the bar itself--the drinks are decent and the booze selection is good--it's the herd that makes it an unsavory place to be. Give it some time and visit after the herd has migrated to newer, trendier pastures.
author: keith s.

description: These guys know how to run a bar. Drinks are quality and strong, the musics on point, the bartenders know their stuff and can give you what you want. The bar deals with a lot of d bags in stride and doesn't let it hinder the night. Cameron at the door handled his shit and doesn't have the typical bouncer mentality. The old fashioned is on point.
author: Luke W.
